description:
The third season of Hibike! Euphonium.

Kumiko's third year finally begins! With the concert band at Kitauji High School over 90 members, Kumiko is now the president and does her best with her final high school club activities to try to win her long-desired gold at nationals.

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)
synonyms: 響け! ユーフォニアム 久美子3年生編

node.description:
A prominent director and a key member of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

After graduating from Osaka Designers' College in the late '80s, Ishihara joined Kyoto Animation and began his career as an animator. In 1991, he made his debut as a director with [Shiawasette Naani](https://anilist.co/anime/13441/). After that, he switched his focus to directing. Back then Kyoto Animation was still a sub-contracting studio, so therefore Ishihara could only get a handful of opportunities directing. Some of the shows in which Ishihara got to direct multiple episodes were [Tenchi Muyou!](https://anilist.co/anime/696/), [Aka-chan to Boku](https://anilist.co/anime/1485/), [Hyper Police](https://anilist.co/anime/1180/), and [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He also storyboarded the majority of the episodes he directed.

In 2003, Kyoto Animation started their transformation into a full-fledged animation studio producing their first anime series, [Fullmetal Panic? Fumoffu](https://anilist.co/anime/72/). Ishihara directed and storyboarded the 7th episode of the show. Two years later in 2005, he made his proper directorial debut directing the studio's second TV show, [Air](https://anilist.co/anime/101/). The following year he directed the award winning anime series, [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/). From here Ishihara has gone on to direct multiple of Kyoto Animation's acclaimed works.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田和美)

Kazumi Ikeda is a Japanese animator and character designer currently affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). She joined KyoAni in 1995 after graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and transferred to the studio's Osaka branch [Animation Do](https://anilist.co/studio/929/Animation-Do) when it was established in 2000.

She is best known for doing the character designs in KyoAni's anime adaptations of Key's most prominent visual novels, [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/1530/Kanon-2006/) and [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/Clannad/), marking also her debut as chief animation director on the Kanon remake.

She has no blood relationship with late [Shouko Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102736/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田和美)

Kazumi Ikeda is a Japanese animator and character designer currently affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). She joined KyoAni in 1995 after graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and transferred to the studio's Osaka branch [Animation Do](https://anilist.co/studio/929/Animation-Do) when it was established in 2000.

She is best known for doing the character designs in KyoAni's anime adaptations of Key's most prominent visual novels, [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/1530/Kanon-2006/) and [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/Clannad/), marking also her debut as chief animation director on the Kanon remake.

She has no blood relationship with late [Shouko Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102736/).
He tragically lost his life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田晶子_(アニメーター%29)

Shouko Ikeda was one of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)'s leading animators.

She went through the Yoyogi animation school and upon graduating joined Kyoto Animation in 1996. The same year she made her debut as an in-betweener on [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/). She also notably served as an animation director on the [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/) episodes that were outsourced to Kyoto Animation. In 2006, she was brought to the spotlight with [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/), a show in which she was the character designer and sole chief animation director. The designs of the series, as well as the general presentation was very well received amongst animation fans.

She has no blood relationship with [Kazumi Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/102724/).

On July 18, 2019, Ikeda was tragically killed alongside 34 of her colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack.

Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) since 1989.

Worked as an animator in the beginning of his career.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayanotakeda)

Ayano Takeda is a Japanese novelist. She aspired to become a novelist when she first read Risa Wataya's *I Want to Kick You in the Back* (蹴りたい背中, *Keritai senaka*). She made her debut while she was a student at Doshisha University with the short novel *Kyou, Kimi to Iki wo Suru* (今日、きみと息をする。). A story about a high school art club. She submitted the novel to the 8th Japan Love Story Award sponsored by Takarajimasha. Her novel was selected as a finalist. Although it did not win the prize, it was later published in May 2013 in the Takarajimasha Bunko collection.

In December 2013, she published her second debut novel *Sound! Euphonium: Welcome to the Kitauji High School Concert Band*. The novel was based on her days in the brass band club during elementary and junior high school. The novel was successful and spawned a manga and a popular anime series by [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/Kyoto-Animation). In 2021, she also won the 42nd Eiji Yoshikawa Literary Newcomer Award for her novel *Aisarenakute mo Betsuni* (愛されなくても別に).

In 2016, she was appointed as a tourism ambassador for her hometown in Uji City.

On September 25, 2022, she announced she got married to a man from outside the manga industry. On July 16, 2024, she announced the birth of her first son.
Masahiro Oowada is a music director and conductor born in Miyagi Prefecture, Japan

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

__Height:__ 160 cm
__Hobbies:__ Looking for new convenience store sweets, playing with dogs
__Skills & Abilities:__ Massage, swimming

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/ayaka_asai) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayakasai0511) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/lucky-girl1010/)

__Non-anime roles:__
Cindy Chandra in "Suke Jan Deka" (VG) (Japanese)
Daisy in "Granado Espada" (MMORPG) (Japanese)
Mirei Hayasaka in "Idolmaster Cinderella Girls: Starlight Stage" (VG/Idol) (Japanese)
Lucy in Zenless Zone Zero (VG) (Japanese)

__Agency:__ Mausu Promotion (2012-2021), Toho Entertainment (2021-)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TomoyoKurosawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoyo_kurosawa_official_/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosawa-tomoyo/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Kurosawa began studying acting at the age of 3. In 2000, she began appearing in TV dramas, commercials and stage performances. At the age of 13, she made her voice acting debut as [Natsuki Koyama](https://anilist.co/character/30214/) in the 2010 anime film [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/).

Kurosawa became a support member of Sound Horizon in 2008.

On June 8, 2023, her agency announced her marriage on Twitter.

__Awards:__
- Best Lead Actress at the 12th Seiyuu Awards in 2018 for her roles as [Phosphophyllite](https://anilist.co/character/123385/) and [Kumiko Oumae](https://anilist.co/character/88708/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile](https://avex-pictures.co.jp/lineup/91485/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chikachika_anzai_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Anchika_manager) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdWglOsvq7Q_3-XM5XMxaqQ) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/chika-anzai/)

She moved to Tokyo at 15 to pursue a voice acting career. She is a voice actress affiliated with Avex Entertainment. She was training at Maho Academy previously. She's a cousin of [Junya Enoki](https://anilist.co/staff/119319).

Won a Best Lead Actor award at the 17th Annual Seiyu Awards (2023).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/toyotamoe) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/toyotamoe/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/toyotamoe/) | [Agency Profile](http://stylecube.jp/talents/moe/index.html)

She is one of the new members of [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177) that joined on April 27, 2013 and is one half of its subunit, [Pyxis](https://anilist.co/staff/139753), along with [Miku Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/118581/Miku-Itou).

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.
